document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Zeugophora (Coleoptera, Megalopodidae, Zeugophorinae) in Japan

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Zeugophora (Coleoptera, Megalopodidae, Zeugophorinae) in Japan

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Pedrillia nigricollis
Jacoby, 1885: 195
[ type locality: Japan : Wada-tôge], synonymized as
Pedrillia bicolor Kraatz, 1879
by
Kimoto, 1986a: 309
;
Chûjô, 1932: 340
[ Japan , Korea ];
Jolivet, 1957: 13
[catalogued].

Zeugophora bicolor :
Gressitt, 1945: 139
[listed]; An & Kwon, 1995: 91–92;
Takizawa, 2006: 2
[listed];
Rodríguez-Mirón, 2018: 291
[listed].

subSubSection.paragraph: Description . Measurement. Body length: PEL, male, 3.22–4.51 mm , female, 3.72–4.75 mm . Width: EW, male, 2.09–2.33 mm , female, 1.97–2.54 mm . Biometric data are given in Table 2 .

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 2. Biometric data for
Zeugophora nigricollis ( Jacoby, 1885 )
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Coloration. Body fulvous. Head black. Apex of mandible black. Antennae black. Pronotum black. Scutellum black. Elytra fulvous. Ventral surface black. Legs black.

Legs densely furnished with setae; tibial setae becoming denser and longer apically. Hind femora thickened. Fore tibiae straight; mid tibiae bowed on apical half; hind tibiae weakly bowed and feebly widened near apex; mid and hind tibiae with a sharply defined and finely crenulate carina along external face. Apex of protibia with one spur; apices of meso- and metatibiae with two spurs. Tarsi distinctly shorter than tibiae, and basal three segments gradually widened apically.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 8.
Zeugophora nigricollis ( Jacoby, 1885 )
. A. Pronotum, dorsal view; B. Thorax, ventral view; C. Antenna; D. Mandible, left part. Scales. A–C. 1 mm; D. 100μm.

FIGURE 9.
Zeugophora nigricollis ( Jacoby, 1885 )
. A. Head; B. Pronotum, dorsal view; C. Thorax, ventral view; D. Male posterior margin of 7th sternite; E. Female posterior margin of 7th sternite.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Host plant .
Euonymus sieboldianus Blume
[Japanese name: Mayumi].

Remarks .
Zeugophora nigricollis
is distinguished from
Z . bicolor ( Kraatz, 1879 )
by the following characters. Color of pronotum; completely black in
Z. nigricollis
, posterior half fulvous in
Z . bicolor
; ventral coloration; black in
Z . nigricollis
, thorax and abdomen fulvous in
Z.bicolor
; male and female genitalia: shape of median lobe; median lobe is shorter and wider and apex of median lobe is narrower in
Z . bicolor
than
Z . nigricollis
( Fig. 11B, I ); shape of spermatheca; stem is longer in
Z . nigricollis
than in
Z . bicolor
( Fig. 11G, J ). Using the above-mentioned characters, I have decided to restore
Z . nigricollis
to a valid species from junior synonymy with
Z . bicolor
.

Types .
Paratype 1 ex. , sex unknown ( TARI ): " FUKUSHIMA , JAPAN ,
28.VII.1881
, Col. G. Lewis ", "Cotype"
, " Pedrillia nigricollis JACOBY , DET . M. CHUJO .", " Pedrillia nigricollis Jac, Det. T. Shiraki. ".

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 10. Setiferous punctures of
Zeugophora nigricollis ( Jacoby, 1885 )
. A. Head surface; B. Pronotum; C. Metaventrite; D. Elytron.
